001package io.jstach.jstachio;
002
003import java.nio.charset.Charset;
004import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
005import java.util.function.Function;
006
007import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
008
009import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheConfig;
010import io.jstach.jstache.JStacheContentType;
011
012/**
013 * Template meta data like its location, formatters, escapers and or its contents.
014 * <p>
015 * This data is usually available on generated {@link Template}s.
016 *
017 * @author agentgt
018 */
019public interface TemplateInfo {
020
021        /**
022         * The logical name of the template which maybe different than
023         * {@link #templatePath()}.
024         * @return logical name of template. Never null.
025         */
026        public String templateName();
027
028        /**
029         * If the template is a classpath resource file this will return the location that was
030         * originally resolved via {@linkplain JStacheConfig config resolution}.
031         * @return the location of the template or empty if the template is inlined.
032         * @apiNote since the return is the original path resolved by the annotation processor
033         * it may return a path with a starting "/" and thus it is recommend you call
034         * {@link #normalizePath()} if you plan on loading the resource.
035         *
036         * @see #normalizePath()
037         */
038        public String templatePath();
039
040        /**
041         * Normalizes the path to used by {@link ClassLoader#getResource(String)}.
042         *
043         * If the templatePath starts with a "/" it is stripped.
044         * @return normalized path
045         */
046        default String normalizePath() {
047                String p = templatePath();
048                if (p.startsWith("/")) {
049                        return p.substring(1);
050                }
051                return p;
052        }
053
054        /**
055         * The raw contents of the template. Useful if the template is inline. To determine if
056         * the template is actually inline use {@link #templateSource()}.
057         * @apiNote An empty or blank template string maybe a valid inline template and does
058         * not mean it is not inline.
059         * @return the raw contents of the template never null.
060         * @see TemplateSource
061         */
062        default String templateString() {
063                return "";
064        }
065
066        /**
067         * The template content type is the class annotated with {@link JStacheContentType}
068         * which also describes the escaper to be used.
069         * @apiNote The class returned must be annotated with {@link JStacheContentType}.
070         * @return the template content type.
071         */
072        Class<?> templateContentType();
073
074        /**
075         * The template {@link Charset} which is the original format of the template file and
076         * should ideally be used when encoding an HTTP response or similar. Furthermore
077         * ideally the template charset matches the chosen {@link #templateContentType()}
078         * {@link JStacheContentType#charsets()} otherwise the escaper may not appropriately
079         * escape.
080         * <p>
081         * IF the template is inline or charset was not set this will usually be
082         * {@link StandardCharsets#UTF_8}.
083         * @return the template Charset.
084         * @see JStacheContentType#charsets()
085         * @see JStacheConfig#charset()
086         */
087        Charset templateCharset();
088
089        /**
090         * The template media-type from the {@link JStacheContentType}.
091         * @return media type maybe an empty string.
092         */
093        String templateMediaType();
094
095        /**
096         * The escaper to be used on the template. See {@link Escaper#of(Function)}.
097         * @apiNote While the return signature is {@link Function} the function is often an
098         * {@link Escaper} but does not have to be.
099         * @return the escaper.
100         * @see Escaper
101         */
102        Function<String, String> templateEscaper();
103
104        /**
105         * The base formatter to be used on the template. See {@link Formatter#of(Function)}.
106         * @apiNote While the return signature is {@link Function} the function is often a
107         * {@link Formatter} but does not have to be.
108         * @return the formatter.
109         * @see Formatter
110         */
111        @SuppressWarnings("exports")
112        Function<@Nullable Object, String> templateFormatter();
113
114        /**
115         * Checks to see if a template supports the model class.
116         * @param type the class of the model.
117         * @return if this renderer supports the class.
118         */
119        public boolean supportsType(Class<?> type);
120
121        /**
122         * Return the model class (root context class annotated with JStache) that generated
123         * this template.
124         * @return model class
125         */
126        public Class<?> modelClass();
127
128        /**
129         * Where the template contents were retrieved from.
130         * @return an enum never null.
131         */
132        default TemplateSource templateSource() {
133                return templatePath().isEmpty() ? TemplateSource.STRING : TemplateSource.RESOURCE;
134        }
135
136        /**
137         * Symbols representing where the template was retrieved from.
138         * @author agentgt
139         */
140        public enum TemplateSource {
141
142                /**
143                 * Template was retrieved from the classpath at compile time.
144                 */
145                RESOURCE,
146                /**
147                 * Template was inlined as a String literal
148                 */
149                STRING
150
151        }
152
153        /**
154         * The last loaded time if applicable.
155         *
156         * For statically compiled templates this will always be a negative number. For
157         * dynamically loaded templates this more likely will return a non negative number
158         * indicating some hint of when the template was last modified or loaded.
159         * @return the last modified or negative if not applicable
160         */
161        default long lastLoaded() {
162                return -1;
163        }
164
165        /**
166         * Utility method similar to toString that describes the template meta data.
167         * @return description of the template.
168         */
169        default String description() {
170                return String.format("TemplateInfo[name=%s, path=%s, contentType=%s, charset=%s]", templateName(),
171                                templatePath(), templateContentType(), templateCharset());
172        }
173
174}
